msDesc.head: Composite manuscript containing a treatise on music and an astrological work.

msContents.summary: Composite manuscript containing a treatise on the Arabic musical tunes by Muẓaffar ibn al-Ḥusain ibn al-Muẓaffar al-Ḥaṣkafi entitled Risālat al-Kashīf fī ʿIlm al-Anghām (The Treatise of the Discoverer in the Science of Melodies), and an astrolomical treatise entitled Ẓuhūr ath-Thariyyā wa-Khafāʿ ma kān wabiyya (The Appearance of the Pleiades and the Disappearance of the Plague-stricken) by Ottoman astronomer Sulaymān ibn Ḥamzah ibn Ḥashīsh.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals. Number 7 has been missed when foliated.

binding.p: Quarter-bound, with marble paper covers. Label on front cover: "MUSIQUE PLEYADES".

msItem.title: Risālat al-Kashīf fī ʿIlm al-Anghām
رسالات الكشاف في عام الانغام
The Treatise of the Discoverer in the Science of Melodies
msItem.author: Muẓaffar ibn al-Ḥusain ibn al-Muẓaffar al-Ḥaṣkafi al-Musīqī (مظفر بن الحسين بن المظفر الحصكفي الموسيقي)
msItem.note: The work is dedicated in the preface to a much-praised but unnamed king.

The author says that all musical tunes are derived from the one called راست. Two of its immediate derivatives are those called دوكاه and سيكاه. From these three are directly derived eight other key-tunes. The remaining tunes to the number of eighteen are derived from the above eleven principal tunes. All musical tunes, therefore, are twenty-one in number.

msItem.title: Ẓuhūr ath-Thariyyā wa-Khafāʿ ma kān wabiyya
ظهور الثريا وخفاء ما كان وبيا
The Appearance of the Pleiades and the Disappearance of the Plague-stricken

author.persName: Sulaymān ibn Ḥamzah ibn Ḥashīsh al-Ḥanafi al-Falaki al-ʿUthmānī ar-Rumi
سليمان بن حمزة بن حشيش الحنفي الفلكي العثماني الروممي

msItem.note: The occasion of the writing of the book is the plague which raged in Egypt in AH 987-988 (1579-1580 CE). The the appearance of the Pleiades (a star cluster in the Taurus constellation) this plague ceased, and the author (an Ottoman astronomer), who died about AH 1010 (1601 CE) was asked to write a treatise on the Pleiades and the influence of the stars in general on the plague.
The manuscript is an autograph of the author, and was written by him in its final form in AH 998 (1589 CE).
